intro: Obeliscotheca, commonly known as the "false lily of the valley," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plants are perennial herbs with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Obeliscotheca species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe and Asia. They prefer moist, shady environments and are often found in woodlands or along stream banks.
